gr.interamerican.bo2.arch
Interface DetachStrategy

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public interface DetachStrategy
extends java.io.Serializable

DetachStrategy is a common interface for strategy objects that undertake the management of detached objects.

Method Summary
 void detach(java.lang.Object object, Provider provider)
          Detaches the object.
 void markExplicitSave(java.lang.Object object, Provider provider)
          Marks the object as excluded from accidental saves due to any automation of the underlying persistence technology.

          Attaches an object.
 

Method Detail

reattach

void reattach(java.lang.Object object,
              Provider provider)
Attaches an object. For environments with managed entities, such as ORM implementations, the semantics of this are as follows.
Re-attaching a detached object includes the re-attaching of referenced (i.e. not owned) detached entities and collections of detached entities, as well as of the object itself.
Re-attaching a transient entity includes the re-attaching of referenced (i.e. not owned) detached entities and collections of detached entities.
Owned entities and collections of entities are assumed to have appropriate cascade options enabled that re-attach them automatically once, their owner is re-attached.

Parameters:
object - Object to attach.
provider - Provider

detach

            Provider provider)
Detaches the object.

Parameters:
object - Object to detach.
provider - Provider.

markExplicitSave

void markExplicitSave(java.lang.Object object,
                      Provider provider)
Marks the object as excluded from accidental saves due to any automation of the underlying persistence technology.

Parameters:
object - Object to mark.
provider - Provider.
